text: - My name is Kris Teutsch.

I'm a senior business
development manager at AWS.
So one of the biggest differences at AWS

in my current role is that
we start every morning
by thinking what the client needs.

This client obsession
concept is what drives us.
So when I get up in the morning

and I think about what
I have to do every day,
I always look at my schedule and say,
"Does this really pertain to the client?
Am I bringing value to the client?"

And if it's not, it gets
deprioritized in what I'm doing.
(upbeat music)
I've had a rather lengthy career in IT.

The thing that's kept me motivated
to continue to work in IT
is to be on the forefront of change.

Information technology has
gone through several waves,
several milestones of dramatic change.

Whether we're talking about
moving from PCs to WANs,
to the internet, et cetera,

those have all been key
milestones within the IT industry.

AWS is on the forefront of
creating cloud technologies

and bringing that to bear is
probably the most dramatic

change in IT in the last
decade, if not longer.
(calm music)
The ability to be in that wave,

to be working on the front
leading edge, changing,

not just the industry from
a technical perspective
across the entire supply chain of business
is what's really appealing to AWS.

And if you wanna do
something that's innovative

and impactful, this is
the company to be at.
